full_threads.body: Brilliant - thanks Heath!

Hi Lizzy, 

Sure, confirming we have updated this.
@heath All good now on this one

That's all looking good thanks!

Last thing I need is the 15 year anniversary lock-up of our logo to display at the top of the automated confirmation emails if possible (the one that's currently displaying in the top left corner of the whole website…)

We're starting to get registrations now so that's great!

Thanks

Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Sure, we have now updated the Roche logo and the other requests. Let me know how it goes?

Hi Heath,

How did you get on with the items below?

Also, sorry to be an absolute pain! I've just had feedback from our fundraising team around the wording that should go with the Roche logo across all of these pages. It actually needs to say 'Major sponsor <Roche logo>' rather than the current 'Event generously sponsored by <Roche logo>'

Really appreciate your help fixing this today as I need to get the official invites out asap and will need these tweaks making first.

Thanks

Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Sure, confirming we have made the below updates: 

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

@heath All done on this one.

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

Hi Heath,

Just some final tweaks to the following pages.

Also the registration confirmation email is still doing the crazy long header in our company outlook…perhaps we just need to remove this banner completely? It looks pretty bad otherwise.

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/

· Agenda - please may the bullet points 'dots' rather than the funny symbol that's currently there

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/

· Date of birth section - the calendar is still really light grey and hard to read - is there any way this can be updated?

· Subscribe to the newsletter section - please make the question text bold like the rest of the questions on the page

· Subscribe to the newsletter section - please make the 'yes' option pre-populated (people should still be able to change this but we'd like it to pre-populate as 'yes')

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/

· Please replace the page title to say: Progress in MS Research Live Update 2019 - Studio Audience

· Agenda - please may the bullet points 'dots' rather than the funny symbol that's currently there

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

· Date of birth section - the calendar is still really light grey and hard to read - is there any way this can be updated?

· Please update the 'What is your relationship to MS?' section so that two of the categories are not cut off:



· Subscribe to the newsletter section - please make the answer options un-bold (yes, no already subscribed) and the same size font as the question answers above

· Subscribe to the newsletter section - please make the 'yes' option pre-populated (people should still be able to change this but we'd like it to pre-populate as 'yes')

· Wheelchair access question - please make the 'yes' 'no' options un-bold and the same size font as the question answers above

· Disclaimer wording at the bottom of the page - please make this a larger font size (the same as the note that sits under the 'do you have a question you would like to submit to the panel' question)

Thanks

Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Yes, we have been through the changes. Here are the links to review: 

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/thankyou/

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/thankyou/
@joel Thanks! I will check later today

@heath all good now on this one.

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/thankyou/

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/thankyou/

Hi Heath,

Great, thanks.

I've just sent the pages to a couple of people in the team here to user test and there are just a few more tweaks.

Unfortunately the header in the confirmation emails is still appearing really distorted in our work outlook emails so is there some sort of work-around we could do on that?

LIVE STREAM PAGES

LIVE STREAM HOMEPAGE: https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/

· Under the 'Where' icon please updates the copy 'Live stream from Melbourne' to just say 'Live stream'

· Please remove hyperlinks on all icons at the top (currently the When icon - hyperlinks to the agenda, Where icon - links to the 2018 event, Cost icon - hyperlinks to the agenda, Format icon hyperlinks to the agenda)

· Agenda table - please update the copy 'Introduction and Welcome to Country' to just say 'Introduction'

· Agenda table - please add the speakers names within the 'individual expert speaker session' section as bullet points:

§ Associate Professor Ellen Mowry

§ Associate Professor Gonçalo Castelo-Branco

§ Professor Tanuja Chitnis

§ Dr Chris Dwyer

· Speakers: High res Tanuja photo attached to replace the existing one (much less 'grainy')

· Speakers: copy is overlapping on Castelo-Branco and Dwyer.


· Footer: Roche logo to be made smaller

· Footer: Roche copy to be updated to read: Event generously supported by <Roche logo>

LIVE STREAM REGISTRATION FORM PAGE:https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/

· Date of birth field: Calendar is difficult to read because the numbers are a really pale grey - can this be updated to be more legible?

· Date of birth field: When you enter your dob (either using the calendar or manually) it reverts to American date format rather than Australian date format. It actually won't let you submit the form id you put your dob in manually in the Australian date format but doesn't tell you that this is why the whole form cannot be submitted - can this please be updated?

· Please make the '*please note due to time restrictions etc' text slightly larger

· Please update the 'What is your relationship to MS?' section so that two of the categories are not cut off:

· Please update the 'Would you like to subscribe to the MS Research Australia newsletter?' options to be regular not bold and the same size font as all the other questions? Can we also have the 'yes' pre-filled as the default?

· Footer: Roche logo to be made smaller

· Footer: Roche copy to be updated to read: Event generously supported by <Roche logo>

LIVE STREAM THANK YOU:https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/thankyou/

· Footer: Roche logo to be made smaller

· Footer: Roche copy to be updated to read: Event generously supported by <Roche logo>

STUDIO AUDIENCE PAGES

STUDIO AUDIENCE HOMEPAGE:https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/

· Please replace the page title to say: Progress in MS Research Live Update 2019 - Studio Audience

· Please remove hyperlinks on all icons at the top (currently the When icon - hyperlinks to the agenda, Where icon - links to the 2018 event, Cost icon - hyperlinks to the agenda, Format icon hyperlinks to the agenda)

· Agenda table - please update 'Introduction and Welcome to Country' to just say 'Introduction'

· Agenda table - please add the speakers names within the 'individual expert speaker session' section as bullet points:

§ Associate Professor Ellen Mowry

§ Associate Professor Gonçalo Castelo-Branco

§ Professor Tanuja Chitnis

§ Dr Chris Dwyer

· Speakers: High res Tanuja photo attached to replace the existing one (much less 'grainy')

· Under 'Venue' section - 'Trains' should be the same level of hierarchy as Trams and Buses (so not in orange subheading text and in alignment)

· Under 'Venue' section - next to trains - correct the typo which says closet so it reads closest

· Link included in the sentence 'More information on Melbourne public transport can be found here.' leads to a 'page not found' error so please update with the following URL: https://www.ptv.vic.gov.au/

· Florey logo (attached) to be added to this page in the footer (to the right of the Roche lock-up).
Copy to be updated to read:
Event generously supported by <Roche logo>
Venue generously provided by <The Florey Logo>

· Roche and Florey logo to both be made smaller

STUDIO AUDIENCE REGISTRATION FORM PAGE:https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

· Date of birth field: Calendar is difficult to read because the numbers are a really pale grey - can this be updated to be more legible?

· Date of birth field: When you enter your dob (either using the calendar or manually) it reverts to American date format rather than Australian date format.

· Florey logo (attached) to be added to this page in the footer (to the right of the Roche lock-up).
Copy to be updated to read:
Event generously supported by <Roche>
Venue kindly provided by <The Florey Logo>

· Roche and Florey logo to be made smaller

STUDIO AUDIENCE THANK YOU:https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/thankyou/

· Florey logo (attached) to be added to this page in the footer (to the right of the Roche lock-up).
Copy to be updated to read:
Event generously supported by <Roche>
Venue kindly provided by <The Florey Logo>

· Roche and Florey logo to be made smaller

Thanks,

Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

Confirming we have made the below changes, let me know how the email looks now?

@heath All good now on this one. I did increase the logo a bit. Let me know if I need to make it bigger? 

Here are the links: 

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/thankyou/

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/thankyou/

Hi Heath,

Thanks for the update.

Apparently its Outlook 2013 desktop. It doesn't look so bad on mobile (although the 'Live Update' logo is coming up pretty small, so this will need to be made larger).

Summary of remaining changes below:

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner (I sent the artwork through earlier in the week from the artworker but let me know if you need it in another format etc in order to action this).

· New speaker Dr Chris Dwyer to be added onto this page under 'speakers' section too.

· Add Dr Dwyer's bio as follows: Dr Dwyer focuses on a gene called MERTK in the immune system, which has been implicated in the development of progressive MS. He will determine whether MERTK acts via immune cells within the brain and spinal cord, or via cells in the blood. Dr Dwyer's aim is to develop a treatment strategy based on MERTK that will target the right type of immune cells in progressive MS.

· Add the 'Supported by Roche' footer to this page

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner

· Add the 'Supported by Roche' footer to this page

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019/register/thankyou/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner

· When icon - update the time to say 9:30am - 12pm (AEDT)


· In the 'agenda' timetable, please update the 'Doors open' time to 9:30am


· Add Dr Dwyer's bio as follows: Dr Dwyer focuses on a gene called MERTK in the immune system, which has been implicated in the development of progressive MS. He will determine whether MERTK acts via immune cells within the brain and spinal cord, or via cells in the blood. Dr Dwyer's aim is to develop a treatment strategy based on MERTK that will target the right type of immune cells in progressive MS.

· Add the following transport details that are currently missing:
Parking More information on parking in the local area can be found on the following websites:

University of Melbourne parking < https://about.unimelb.edu.au/news-resources/campus-services-and-facilities/transport-and-parking/parking-on-campus >

Parkopedia car park finder < https://www.parkopedia.com.au/parking/carpark/university_of_melbourne_parkville_campus_royal_parade/3053/parkville/?arriving=201909181730&leaving=201909181930 >

Public transportTrams

9 (stops Royal Parade outside the venue)

Buses

505, 546 (both stop on Royal Parade outside the venue)

Trains

Closet stations in order of distance from the venue:North Melbourne Railway Station
Southern Cross Railway Station
Flinders Street Railway Station

More information on Melbourne public transport can be found here.
< https://www.ptv.vic.gov.au/more/travelling-on-the-network/visiting-melbourne-and-victoria/>

· Add the 'Supported by Roche' footer to this page

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner

· Do you require wheelchair access at the venue?* Yes or No checkboxes

· Add the 'Supported by Roche' footer to this page

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/thankyou/

· Make 'Live update' logo a bit larger within the banner

Thanks

Lizzy

Hi Lizzy, 

The below updates have all been made. Regarding the email display, can I ask what device and email software you are using, because we can't replicate the issue at our end. And is anyone else in the office seeing the same issue?

@heath Let me know if this is ok? any clues on the email? do you think she needs to click something before she see all the images?

https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/
https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/

Hi Heath,

Thanks - I'm just going through reviewing the updates. Meanwhile here's a few other bits for this project.

· Attached is our 4th speaker to be added to both the pages the speakers feature on. Copy as follows:

Dr Chris Dwyer, Florey Institute of Neuroscience and Mental Health & The Royal Melbourne Hospital

Bio to follow - I'm just chasing this down.

· Please add a 'supported by Roche' (using the Roche logo attached) white strip at the bottom of each Live update page…similar to how it's done on this charity page https://www.curebraincancer.org.au/page/121/ways-to-give

· Attached is a screenshot of the image scrolling issue on the confirmation emails…

· On this page: https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/ the 'door open' item on the agenda should say 9:30am (rather than 10am)

· On this page: https://msra.org.au/events/liveupdate2019studio/register/ please remove the copy from the beginning of the disclaimer that says: Add Studio Audience disclaimer here:Please also make the disclaimer a smaller font size and italics

Thanks

Lizzy

attachments.filename: Screenshot of image scrolling down the email.jpg

full_threads.body:
Hi Lizzy, 

We have updated as requested. A couple of things: 

  1. The photo of Professor Chitnis is grainy as the one we have is low quality. If we can get a better resolution one, that would be ideal.
  2. We weren't able to replicate the email issue "it’s displaying for several scrolls down of the email" - Can you please send a screenshot?
@heath All good on the document changes except the "Fix the Live Update banner within the email (it’s displaying for several scrolls down of the email)".

Hi Lizzy, 

Thanks for the feedback items, we are working through them. Can you please either a larger version or .ai, .pdf or .eps version of the live update logo? If we make it bigger on the site, it will look grainy with the version we have.

Hi Heath,

Please find feedback on these pages attached.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks

Lizzy
